channel.description: Recent content in servicenow on Dude

item.title: Yay, me. ServiceNow Certified System Administrator once again
item.description: So earlier today I had a little bit of time to kill because of an instance upgrade, so I decided to retake my ServiceNow Certified System Administrator certification. Which is kind of a mouthful, but it's just not that important to enough people for there to be a handy acronym like CCNA or SAT. But it's important to me, and I passed. Woo! For people who work on the ServiceNow platform the system administrator certification is the most common shingle to seek, and it demonstrates that I know enough about where all the levers and gears are in ServiceNow to be permitted admin access without everyone else in the organization sweating bullets.
